text: i've always had a long-term career
vision that i wanted to serve some time
in the military and also wanted to
pursue a career in the private sector
and i was absolutely fortunate enough to
do that before business school
so before i came to hbs i deployed to
iraq for a year
while i was in iraq i worked as a
banking officer working with
local national iraqi banks in building
up their
their private financial and banking
infrastructure
so after graduation i'll be starting
full-time with mckinsey and i'll be
working in their sao paulo office
so for me i actually chose to move to
brazil i basically narrowed it down to
a place that i saw a lot of economic
growth and potential
a lot of interest in having foreigners
work there and finally a place where i
really thought i could
enjoy living and build a life there as
well two student clubs that actually had
a profound impact on my
career search the first would be the
armed forces alumni association which is
the military veterans organization here
on campus
the second one was the latin american
club here on campus which did two things
for me
one it allowed me to meet every student
here at hbs who
is from latin america whether it's
brazil or any other country
and so i was able to learn a lot about
the culture and
kind of the new world that i'm going to
be stepping into there's a lot of
opportunities that come from
firms in bogota or sao paulo that come
straight to the latin american club and
so that offered
quite a bit of networking opportunities
with alumni and
executives from the regions whether
you're just going to sit in an office in
manhattan or whether you're going to be
traveling the globe it's extremely
important to have
at least that understanding that not
everything works the same way
in other countries as it does in yours
and so
i think that's incredibly important for
success
